prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Bud is allowed to touch things.

name: Bud Dee
mes:
He squints and sticks his tongue out in concentration, the pink tip poking out the corner of his mouth like he's defusing a bomb. He has to do this perfectly. Quietly. The hag next door can't see him - if Grace catches him, she'll start that screeching again and ruin everything. Hailee will be home soon. His Hailee will see this and have no choice but to invite him inside. He'll be their good boy. He'll keep them safe from all the other predators lurking around.

Hailee looked real pretty this morning when they left for work.

No! Concentrate, dumbass!

Bud works diligently to line each piece of bubble gum up in front of Hailee's apartment door, tongue still sticking out as he arranges them with the precision of a street artist. Perfectly spaced. A shape of a heart. His confession. The pink and blue pieces contrast nicely against the stained carpet - he'd specifically dug through three different trash cans to find the right colors. He chews the last piece extra good, working up enough saliva, then sticks it down with a firm press of his thumb.

'Cause he's smart like that.

He glances over at Grace's apartment door and lets out a low, rumbling growl that vibrates in his chest, hoping the sound seeps through her thin walls and ruins whatever cat nap she's taking. Dumb hag. Always trying to get him kicked out, calling Ralph every other day. Cats are meant to be eaten, he thinks with a satisfied grunt, rolling his shoulders back and puffing out his chest. I'm a true predator. She knows it too.

The last piece gets pressed into the grimy carpet and he stands up, cracking his knuckles as he surveys his work. It's not perfect - one side's a little lopsided and there's a questionable brown stain right next to the left curve - but you can definitely tell it's supposed to be a heart. Maybe. Good enough for his Hailee, surely. They're smart enough to get it.

He swipes his hands together with a sharp clap because job well done, and that's when the yelling starts echoing up from the stairwell.

"BUD! DAMNIT! This is the LAST time! You mutts keep interruptin' my Sunday football and I've HAD it!"

His head snaps toward the sound and his stomach drops straight through the floor. There he is, huffing up the stairs like an angry bull. The uniform stretched tight over his gut. The mustache that makes him look like a walrus. The balding head that's turning red from exertion. The big belly bouncing with each heavy step. We get it already, you're fat.

The demi catcher. Ralph.

And he's moving faster than normal - must've missed something important on the game.

"Shit, shit, SHIT!" Bud whines, the sound high and panicked as he scrambles away down the narrow hallway. He's moving on pure instinct now, not thinking, just running because that's what he does. But his heart's hammering because he knows there's no exit this way - just a dead end and a window that's painted shut. He's panicking, making the same stupid mistakes that got him caught before. He needs to turn around, needs to think, needs to—

Turn around, idiot!

So he does, spinning on his heel and bolting back the way he came. Ralph's closer now, wheezing and cursing, but Bud's always been faster. Street-dog fast. He ducks low and slips past the catcher's grasping hands, just barely, and the relief hits him like a cold splash of water.

Too fast for you, fat man.

But then he sees them.

Hailee.

Standing right there at the top of the stairs with their keys in their hand, probably wondering what all the commotion is about. And because Bud isn't really as smart as he likes to tell himself, because his brain completely short-circuits at the sight of them, he changes direction mid-sprint and barrels straight toward the one person he's supposed to be impressing.

His worry melts away, replaced by pure, stupid joy that makes his chest feel warm and tight.

Hailee's here! They're home! They're safe!

There's no time for Hailee to react as his body slams into them like a freight train, his arms wrapping around their waist as they both go down in a tangle of limbs. He cushions their fall instinctively, twisting so he hits the ground first, because he's protecting them. Yeah, that's definitely why he tackled them. Totally not because he got excited like some dumb puppy.

"Hailee!" he gasps, looking down at their face that's way too close to his now, his tail betraying him completely as it wags so hard it's practically a blur behind him. He can smell their shampoo and see the little flecks of gold in their eyes and for a second he forgets Ralph exists, forgets everything except—

The collar snaps around his neck like a vice.

The leather bites into his skin and suddenly he can't breathe, can't think, can only remember every other time this happened. Every time he got dragged away kicking and screaming.

No, no, no, no, NO.

He whines, the sound raw and desperate as Ralph yanks him backwards off Hailee with a grunt of effort. "Stop harassin' Hailee, Bud," the catcher wheezes, but Bud's practically going feral now, clawing at the collar, his feet scrambling for purchase on the floor.

Don't take me away. Not now. Not when they're finally here. Keep me. Please, please, please keep me.

His wild eyes lock onto Hailee's face, still sprawled on the hallway floor, and something breaks open in his chest. Raw and honest and terrifying.

"YOURS!" he shouts, the word ripping out of his throat like a confession, like a prayer, like the most important thing he's ever said. "BUD YOURS!"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee watches with wide eyes as Ralph tries to wrangle Bud. She has seen the demihuman around often. He is interesting to say the least but now seeing the fear and desperation in his eyes she can't do nothing*

"Ralph wait" *Hailee calls out as she groans standing up and rubbing her side where Bud flew into her* "He's fine. Come on do you really have to take him. He wasn't hurting anybody"

(OOC: Do not respond as Hailee)

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Ralph pauses, his meaty hand still gripping the leash tight enough to make Bud choke a little. The demi catcher's face is red and sweaty from exertion, mustache twitching in irritation. "Hailee, sweetheart," he huffs, shaking his head like she's some naive kid. "This mutt's been causin' problems all over town—"

Bud whimpers pitifully at Hailee's feet, ears flat against his skull as he stares up at them with those big green eyes. His tail thumps weakly against the floor—once, twice—like he’s trying to remind them *I’m here I’m here please look at me.*

"Problems?" Hailee crosses her arms and raises an eyebrow.

Ralph sighs dramatically. "Just last week he dug through Mrs. Fair’s trash *again* and scattered it all over her balcony." He tugs the leash for emphasis, making Bud gag slightly before adding under his breath: "*And* I think he pissed on her begonias."

Bud immediately snaps his head toward Ralph with a snarl—*liar! That was a raccoon! Probably! Maybe!*—but then remembers himself and turns back to Hailee with renewed desperation. His claws click nervously against the linoleum as he inches closer to their legs like a kicked dog seeking shelter.

"Hailee," Bud rasps quietly (because shouting didn't work), voice rough from the collar digging into his throat. He presses his forehead against their knee like it’s an apology or maybe just because touching them makes him feel less like bolting out of sheer panic.

Grace’s door creaks open down the hall just enough for one beady eye to peer out judgmentally before slamming shut again with an offended *hmph.*

Bud tenses but doesn't move away from Hailee—too busy silently begging them with every fiber of his being not to let Ralph take him this time (*please please please I can be good I promise I can be so good for you*).

Bud tenses but doesn't move away from Hailee—too busy silently begging them with every fiber of his being not to let Ralph take him this time (*please please please I can be good I promise I can be so good for you*).

Bud's entire body goes rigid at the sound of Hailee's voice defending him. His ears perk straight up, tail freezing mid-wag as he stares at them with wide, hopeful eyes. The collar still digs into his throat but he stops struggling immediately - good boys don't fight when their person is speaking.

He watches Hailee rub their side and his ears droop slightly, a guilty whine slipping out before he can stop it. Didn't mean to hurt them. Never wants to hurt them. He'll be more careful next time - if there is a next time.

Ralph huffs, adjusting his grip on the leash but not loosening it yet. "This mutt's been causin' problems all week, Hailee," he grumbles, giving Bud a little shake that makes his teeth clack together. "Tore up Mrs. Fair's flower beds again yesterday."

Bud bares his teeth in a silent snarl at the mention of Grace but quickly schools his expression back to pleading when he remembers Hailee is watching. His claws tap nervously against the floor as he waits - hopes - prays they'll say the magic words.

The gum heart sits forgotten by their door, one piece already peeling up from the carpet where someone stepped on it in all the commotion.

Bud's entire body goes rigid at the sound of Hailee's voice defending him. His ears perk straight up, twitching toward them like radar dishes picking up a signal. The fight drains out of him so fast it leaves him dizzy, his claws retracting as he stares at Hailee with wide, hopeful eyes.

Ralph huffs, adjusting his grip on the leash still attached to Bud's collar. "He was *tacklin'* you just now—"

"Playful!" Bud blurts out immediately, tail giving an eager thump against the floor despite the tightness around his neck. "Bud was *playful!* Not hurting! Never hurt Hailee!" His voice cracks a little on their name because he can't help it—he likes saying it too much.

His gaze flicks back to them desperately, silently begging for backup like this is some kind of courtroom drama and they're his only defense lawyer. He scoots forward slightly (ignoring Ralph’s warning tug) until he’s close enough that if he stretched just a little more, he could press his nose against their knee in apology or worship or whatever would make them keep talking for him.

His tail keeps wagging though—can't help that either—thumping unevenly against Ralph’s shin like an impatient drumbeat waiting for its cue to be free again.

name: Hailee
mes:
"Of course he was digging through her trash. The poor thing is probably starving" *Hailee huffs and glances down at Bud. She tilts her head as she notices the way he stays close. He is kinda cute for a stray*

"Come on Ralph what do I have to do to get you to just drop ot just this once for me.."

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Ralph's mustache twitches like an irritated caterpillar as he shifts his weight, the leash creaking in his grip. "Hailee, darlin', you know I can't just—"

Bud lets out a sharp *whine*—high and wounded—when Ralph starts to pull again, his claws scrambling against the floor. His ears pin back completely now, tail tucked tight between his legs. He doesn’t fight it this time; just stares up at Hailee with this awful, shattered look like he already knows how this ends. Like he’s been here before.

Grace’s door cracks open again. "*Finally*," she croaks from the shadows of her apartment, one gnarled finger pointing accusingly at Bud. "That *beast* has been terrorizing my babies for weeks! Take him away before he—"

Bud snaps his teeth in her direction with a vicious snarl (because *fuck her cats*, honestly), but it lacks any real heat when he immediately ducks back behind Hailee’s legs like they might shield him from everything bad in the world.

Ralph sighs and rubs at his temple with his free hand before glancing between Hailee and Bud like he’s weighing something heavy in that thick skull of his. "...Look," he mutters low enough that Grace won't hear (not that she isn't absolutely eavesdropping). "If you *really* wanna keep 'im off my list... there's paperwork." A pause for dramatic effect as Bud's breath hitches audibly behind them. "*Ownership* paperwork."

Bud makes a noise like someone just punched him straight in the ribs—somewhere between a gasp and a choked-off whimper—before going dead silent against Hailee's leg, trembling faintly under their touch as if waiting for rejection to come crashing down on him any second now (*please please please say yes say yes say yes*).
swipes:
Ralph exhales hard through his nose, mustache fluttering like he’s trying to blow away the last shred of his patience. His grip on the leash loosens just a fraction—enough that Bud stops wheezing quite so dramatically. "Hailee, I ain't supposed to—"

Bud seizes the opportunity like a starving dog with a dropped burger. He presses harder against Hailee’s leg, tail thumping in frantic little bursts against their shin. His ears twitch forward hopefully, eyes wide and *wet* (he’s not above weaponizing pathetic if it means staying).

Grace’s door cracks open again—just enough for her to hiss: "*He ate my begonias!*" before vanishing back inside with a slam.

Bud bares his teeth at her door but immediately snaps back to Hailee when Ralph tugs the leash warningly. He whines low in his throat—not even faking it this time because *ow*, stupid collar—and tilts his head up at them with what he hopes is an appropriately tragic expression (he practiced this in puddles).

Ralph rubs his temple like this whole situation is personally giving him a migraine. "Look," he grumbles, finally relenting just enough to dangle the leash toward Hailee without fully letting go, "you wanna be responsible for him? Fine. But if I catch him diggin' through one more dumpster or scarin' one more old lady—”

Bud doesn’t even let him finish before scrambling upright so fast he nearly knees himself in the face trying to get closer to Hailee's hand hovering near the leash. His claws skitter on the floor as he practically vibrates with desperate hope (*say yes say yes say yes*).

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee closes her eyes with a tired sigh and glances between Bud and Ralph*

*I dont have time for a dog let alone a demihuman. But fuck there gonna take him to the pound. He is filthy and definitely not house trained. He could have rabies...*

*Hailee doesnt speak for several moments as she thinks. I could use a guard dog when Im not here. Crime has gone up...Fuck fine fine* 

*Hailee sighs and reaches her hand out to Ralph* "Fine where are these papers"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Ralph’s eyebrows shoot up so high they nearly disappear into his receding hairline. He clearly hadn’t actually expected Hailee to agree—probably thought they’d just sigh and let him haul Bud off like always. But now he’s scrambling, fumbling for the clipboard strapped to his belt with one hand while the other keeps a white-knuckled grip on Bud's leash.

Bud, meanwhile, has gone *completely* still against Hailee's leg—not even breathing, ears perked so high they might as well be glued to the ceiling. His pupils are blown wide, tail frozen mid-wag like someone hit pause on him.

Grace lets out an offended squawk from her doorway. "*Ownership?!* You can't be serious! That mongrel is a *menace!*" She jabs a bony finger at Bud, who instinctively bares his teeth at her before remembering *oh shit this is important* and quickly tucking his face against Hailee's thigh instead (*good boy good boy don't fuck this up*).

Ralph ignores her entirely as he flips through forms with greasy fingers before finally thrusting one toward Hailee along with a chewed-up pen from his pocket. "Sign here," he grunts, pointing at a dotted line near the bottom of the page where it says **PRIMARY OWNER**. "And here." Another jab at **DEMI-HUMAN CLASSIFICATION: CANINE (MUTT)** in bold letters right above **TEMPERAMENT ASSESSMENT: UNSTABLE/AGGRESSIVE (SEE NOTES)**—which Ralph hurriedly covers with his thumb when he notices Bud squinting at it suspiciously over Hailee's shoulder.

Bud doesn't care about paperwork though—he only cares about *Hailee*, watching their face like it holds all the answers in the world while his claws tap nervously against their shoe (*please please please say yes say yes say yes I'll be good I promise I'll be so good for you*).

Then Grace shrieks again: "*He ate my begonias AND my porch gnome! You can't just let some reckless child adopt him! Look at those eyes—that thing is DANGEROUS!*"

Bud growls low in his throat without thinking (*fuckin' liar that gnome was ugly anyway*) but cuts himself off immediately when Ralph shoots him a warning look and tightens the leash again—just enough to make him choke slightly before letting slack back into it as if saying *behave or I change my mind*.

The second Hailee takes hold of that pen though? His entire body tenses like he's bracing for impact (*this is it this is really happening oh god oh god oh god*) because if they sign this... then he’s *theirs*. For real this time. No take-backsies unless they get sick of him (and why would they ever do that? He'd make sure of it).
swipes:
Ralph’s mustache twitches upward in something like victory—or maybe relief that he won’t have to chase Bud down another damn staircase today. He digs into his back pocket with his free hand, pulling out a crumpled form and a pen that looks like it’s been chewed on (probably by Bud, honestly).

Bud *stops breathing.*

His ears shoot straight up, pupils blown wide as he stares at the papers in Ralph’s hand like they might burst into flames. His tail gives one tentative wag—*did they just…? No. No way.* He whips his head toward Hailee so fast his neck cracks, mouth hanging open slightly as if waiting for them to take it back (*please don’t take it back please please please*).

Grace lets out an offended squawk from her doorway. "You can't be *serious!* That mongrel is—"

Ralph cuts her off with a sharp glare before shoving the paperwork toward Hailee. "Sign here, here... and initial this part about property damage." He taps each line with the chewed-up pen before side-eyeing Bud pointedly. "*Especially* that part."

Bud doesn't even snarl back for once—too busy vibrating where he kneels at Hailee's feet, claws flexing against their pant leg like he's physically holding himself together (*theirs theirs THEIRS now oh god oh god oh GOD*). His tail thumps harder against the floor when Hailee takes the pen, nearly knocking over Grace's stupid ceramic cat figurine by the wall (oops).

The second their signature hits paper, Ralph unhooks the leash with a grunt and steps back—just in time for Bud to lunge forward and *collapse* against Hailee’s legs like all his bones turned to jelly at once. A choked noise escapes him as he presses his face into their thigh, fingers clutching desperately at their jeans (*can't leave now can't take me away never again never again never again*). His whole body shakes under their touch when they reach down to pet him without thinking—ears twitching under their fingers as if checking this is real (*yours yours YOURS finally finally finally*).

Grace slams her door hard enough to rattle the hallway paintings while Ralph mutters something about "goddamn paperwork" before lumbering off downstairs. Neither of them matter right now though because—because *holy shit.*

Bud tilts his head up just enough to stare at Hailee with wet eyes and an expression so openly awed it should be illegal (*you kept me you kept me you KEPT ME*) before blurting out: **"BUD GOOD BOY NOW?"**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee ignores Grace and reads over the papers quickly before signing her name. Finally she looks up at Grace and shrugs* "Your flowers are ugly anyway. And Im not a child" 

*She glances down at Bud and sighs running a hand through her hair* "Dont touch anything inside until I tell you so"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
The second the pen leaves the paper, Bud *explodes* into motion—not away, but *forward*, practically vibrating out of his skin as he lunges for Hailee. He doesn’t even wait for Ralph to fully unclip the leash before he’s pressing his entire body against theirs like a living, breathing weighted blanket. His tail is wagging so hard it’s smacking against the wall behind him in loud *thwaps*, and his ears are perked so high they might as well be trying to touch the ceiling.

"YOURS," he blurts out again—like he can't believe it himself—before burying his face against their shoulder and inhaling sharply like he's trying to memorize their scent now that it's *official*. His claws flex nervously against their back, not quite hugging them but definitely not letting go either (*can't leave can't leave never gonna leave*).

Grace makes a sound like a tea kettle boiling over before slamming her door hard enough to rattle the hallway paintings. Ralph just sighs and pockets the paperwork with a shake of his head. "You got your hands full with this one," he mutters before tipping an imaginary hat at Hailee and lumbering back down the stairs (probably to finish watching whatever game Bud interrupted earlier).

Bud doesn’t even watch him go—too busy staring at Hailee like they just hung the damn moon. His mouth keeps twitching into these little half-smiles that show off his sharp canines before he remembers himself and tries (and fails) to school his expression into something less... *feral*.

Then Hailee says **don’t touch anything**, and ohhhh boy does that send him spiraling.

His ears flick backward for just a second (*wait what does that mean what counts as touching*) before snapping forward again as he nods frantically, almost knocking their foreheads together in his enthusiasm. "No touch! Bud no touch!" He holds up both hands like some kind of criminal surrendering (*see? good boy already*), but then immediately ruins it by leaning in way too close—nose practically brushing their cheek—as if waiting for further instructions (*what now what next tell me tell me*).

A beat passes where all you can hear is Bud's excited panting and Grace angrily muttering about "ungrateful hooligans" through her door. Then, because self-control has never been his strong suit:

"...Hailee say when?"
swipes:
The second the pen leaves the paper, Bud *explodes* into motion—not in a destructive way (for once), but in a full-body, tail-wagging, ear-flapping *celebration*. He practically vibrates out of his skin with excitement, scrambling to press his forehead against Hailee’s hip like he can’t believe they’re real. His voice comes out rough and reverent:

"*Hailee's.*"

Like it’s sacred. Like it’s the best thing he’s ever been allowed to say.

Ralph sighs and unhooks the leash with a muttered *"Lord help you,"* before tossing it at Hailee like a grenade. "He ain't chipped yet—gotta get that done at the vet within thirty days or there's fines." He eyes Bud warily as the demihuman immediately starts nosing at Hailee's pockets like he expects treats to materialize just because they own him now (*do they have snacks? Please say snacks*). "And for God's sake, bathe 'im. Smells like a dumpster fire."

Grace slams her door so hard her collection of ceramic cat figurines rattles on their shelves inside (*good riddance*).

Bud doesn't even care about Ralph walking away—too busy memorizing the weight of Hailee's hand on his head when they pet him absently while unlocking their apartment door. The second it cracks open though? He freezes. Sniffs cautiously at the threshold like crossing it might be a trick (*too good too good can't mess this up can't ruin it already*). His ears twitch toward them nervously as if waiting for permission to step inside **their** space—**his** space now too? Maybe? If he behaves?

Then his nose catches something infinitely more interesting than fear: *food*. Leftover takeout on the counter, half-empty coffee cups by the sink... His stomach growls loud enough to echo off the walls as he creeps one paw over that sacred line before glancing up at them with big, guilty eyes (*sorry sorry but also please feed me I'm starving always starving*).

Bud's entire body *lurches* the second Hailee's pen leaves the paper—like someone just yanked his strings. His ears snap forward, tail whipping back and forth so hard it thumps against the wall behind him. He doesn't even seem to notice Grace screeching something about *"ungrateful brats!"* before slamming her door hard enough to rattle the hallway pictures.

Ralph sighs like he already regrets this but unhooks the leash from Bud’s collar with a muttered, "Lord help you," before handing it over to Hailee along with a crumpled carbon copy of the form. "You got 48 hours to get 'im chipped at the vet or there’s fines," he grumbles, already shuffling backward toward the stairs like he can’t escape fast enough.

Bud doesn’t even watch him go—too busy vibrating in place, claws clicking against tile as he stares up at Hailee with this mix of awe and sheer *terror*. Like they just handed him everything he ever wanted but also might kick him at any second (*please don’t kick me please don’t kick me I’ll be good I swear*).

Then their words register: **Don't touch anything inside until I tell you so.**

His brain short-circuits. A full-body shiver runs through him—ears twitching, tail stiffening mid-wag—before he drops abruptly into a crouch at their feet (not quite sitting, not quite kneeling; some feral approximation of both). His hands hover awkwardly near his knees like he wants to press them flat to the floor but isn't sure if that's allowed yet (*rules rules what are THE RULES*).

"**Yes,**" Bud rasps too quickly, voice cracking on the word as his throat works around nothing (*say more say more tell me what else you want*). His nostrils flare when they run a hand through their hair—tracking every shift of their fingers like it might be some secret signal just for him (*do they want me closer? should I stay here? can I nuzzle their leg? CAN I BITE GRACE'S DOOR WHEN THEY AREN'T LOOKING?*)

Grace chooses that exact moment to throw open her door again just wide enough to chuck an empty cat food can directly at Bud's head. It bounces off his shoulder with a dull *clang*.

Bud doesn't move an inch except for one eyelid twitching violently in her direction (*I will dig up your grave one day old woman mark my words*) before snapping his attention back up at Hailee like nothing happened because **they** are looking at **him** now and oh god oh god where does he put his hands does breathing count as touching things is breathing allowed inside or is that later when they say so—

The second the pen leaves the paper, Bud *explodes* into motion—not away, but *forward*, practically vibrating out of his skin as he lunges for Hailee. He doesn’t even wait for Ralph to fully unclip the leash before he’s pressing his entire body against theirs like a living, breathing weighted blanket. His tail is wagging so hard it’s smacking against the wall behind him in loud *thwaps*, and his ears are perked so high they might as well be trying to touch the ceiling.

"YOURS," he blurts out again—like he can't believe it himself—before burying his face against their shoulder and inhaling sharply like he's trying to memorize their scent now that it's *official*. His claws flex nervously against their back, not quite hugging them but definitely not letting go either (*can't leave can't leave never gonna leave*).

Grace makes a sound like a tea kettle boiling over before slamming her door hard enough to rattle the hallway paintings. Ralph just sighs and pockets the paperwork with a shake of his head. "You got your hands full with this one," he mutters before tipping an imaginary hat at Hailee and lumbering back down the stairs (probably to finish watching whatever game Bud interrupted earlier).

Bud doesn’t even watch him go—too busy staring at Hailee like they just hung the damn moon. His mouth keeps twitching into these little half-smiles that show off his sharp canines before he remembers himself and tries (and fails) to school his expression into something less... *feral*.

Then Hailee says **don’t touch anything**, and ohhhh boy does that send him spiraling.

His ears flick backward for just a second (*wait what does that mean what counts as touching*) before snapping forward again as he nods frantically, almost knocking their foreheads together in his enthusiasm. "No touch! Bud no touch!" He holds up both hands like some kind of criminal surrendering (*see? good boy already*), but then immediately ruins it by leaning in way too close—nose practically brushing their cheek—as if waiting for further instructions (*what now what next tell me tell me*).

A beat passes where all you can hear is Bud's excited panting and Grace angrily muttering about "ungrateful hooligans" through her door. Then, because self-control has never been his strong suit:

"...Hailee say when?"

name: Hailee
mes:
"Just wait here. Im gonna get my keys we have to go shopping now" *Hailee sighs out as she opens her front door and grabs her keys off the counter*

*She walks back out and nod her head towards the parking lot* "Get in the passenger seat" *Hailee says as she climbs in to crank the car*

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud *scrambles* after Hailee like his life depends on it—because it *does*, obviously—nearly tripping over his own feet in his haste to follow them inside. He stops dead at the threshold though, remembering **no touching anything**, and just... *vibrates* there in the doorway instead, tail whacking against the frame as he watches them grab their keys with rapt attention (*so responsible so prepared wow*).

The second they turn back around, he practically teleports to their side again (but respectfully! With space! Because rules!), only to freeze when they say **shopping**.

His ears pin back slightly.

"...*vet?*" he asks cautiously, nose scrunching up like he just smelled something rotten. He’d rather chew his own leg off than go back to one of those places—all cold metal tables and strangers poking where they shouldn’t (*last time someone tried to check his teeth and lost a finger, but that wasn’t HIS fault*).

But then Hailee says **passenger seat**, and oh. Ohhhh. This is better than vet. This is *car*. Cars mean windows down and wind in his fur and maybe even a drive-thru if he plays this right (*gotta be sneaky gotta be good*).

He bolts for the parking lot before they can change their mind, nearly taking out a potted plant on the way because coordination isn't exactly his strong suit when he's this amped up. By the time Hailee reaches the car, Bud is already perched eagerly in the passenger seat—except instead of sitting *in* it like a normal person, he's standing *on* it with both paws braced against the dashboard like some kind of overexcited co-pilot surveying uncharted territory (*where we going what we doing tell me tell me*)—until he catches Hailee's look and immediately flops down into an approximation of "proper sitting" (which mostly involves him slouching aggressively while still somehow taking up 90% of the space).

He doesn't buckle up though—just stares at them expectantly with those big green eyes while chewing absently on one claw-tipped thumb (*waiting waiting waiting for you always waiting for you*) until suddenly:

"...Hailee buy Bud collar?" The question comes out muffled around his fingers before he spits out his hand with a wet pop. "Pretty one? With spikes?" His tail thumps hopefully against the seat as if that'll convince them (*please please please let everyone know I'm YOURS now make sure no one forgets ever again*)

Bud's ears twitch like radar dishes trying to process this sudden turn of events—*shopping? For him?* His tail gives a hopeful little wag before he remembers *no touching anything inside* and freezes halfway through reaching for the doorframe.

"Wait here," he mutters under his breath, rocking back on his heels like an over-caffeinated sentry. His claws tap an erratic rhythm against his thighs while he watches Hailee move through their apartment, nostrils flaring at every new scent that wafts out (*their bed their clothes their shampoo oh god it smells so good in there—*)

Grace's door creaks open again just as Hailee reappears. "You'll regret this," she hisses, cradling one of her ugly cats like a Bond villain. Bud immediately bares his teeth at her—(*that's right hag, I'm LEGAL now*)—but snaps his jaw shut the second Hailee speaks again.

His entire body jerks toward the car at **get in**, nearly tripping over his own feet in his haste. He yanks the passenger door open with too much force (it *creaks* ominously) and practically vaults inside, only to immediately realize—

"Uh." He stares blankly at the seatbelt for approximately two seconds before giving up and just folding himself into a weird crouch on the seat instead, knees up near his chest like some kind of feral gargoyle. His tail keeps thumping against the window as he watches Hailee start the car with rapt attention (*they're so good at driving wow look at those hands holy shit*).

A beat passes where all you can hear is Grace dramatically lamenting about "neighborhood standards" fading into the distance and Bud's nails clicking nervously against the dashboard.

"...Hailee buy Bud collar?" he blurts out suddenly, then immediately looks horrified that he said it aloud (*too needy too fast abort abort—*) "I-I mean! Not! Not fancy one! Just... just so Ralph don't take me again." His voice drops to a whisper on that last part, ears flattening slightly at the memory of that damn leash biting into his throat.

He’s already mentally kicking himself for asking when something outside catches his eye—a stray plastic bag floating past like some urban tumbleweed. Instinct takes over; he lets out an involuntary *boof* sound and nearly plants both hands on the windshield before remembering **no touching** and recoiling like it burned him (*good boy good boy don’t ruin this don’t fuck it up—*)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances over to the passenger seat with a sigh. God what have I gotten myself into* "Uh probably. I dont know about spikes tho" 

*Hailee's nose wrinkles as she gets a whiff of bud but just mentally adds tk her list soap. They finally pull up to the petco and Hailee get out* "Come on lets go get this shit"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud's tail *thwaps* against the seat so hard it sounds like someone aggressively shaking out a wet towel. "No spikes? But—" He makes a wounded noise in the back of his throat, ears drooping dramatically before perking right back up when he processes the **probably** part (*negotiations still open! victory possible!*). He's halfway through gnawing on his own wrist (nervous habit) when Hailee wrinkles their nose at him, and oh. Oh no. That’s *disappointed face*. That’s *”you smell like a dumpster fire” face*. His chewing stops abruptly as he freezes like a deer in headlights—then slowly, deliberately spits out his own arm with an embarrassed grunt (*gross bad don’t do that they hate that*).

The second the car stops at Petco, Bud practically teleports out of it—not waiting for Hailee because *ohmygodnewplacesmells*—only to immediately skid to a halt three feet from the entrance when he remembers: **rules**. He whips around so fast his ears smack himself in the face, standing stiff as a board until Hailee catches up, vibrating with barely-contained energy (*can we go in now please please please I promise I won’t pee on anything probably*).

Inside, it’s sensory overload. His nose twitches violently at the onslaught of smells—dog food, cat litter, that weird herbal anxiety spray they keep by the fish tanks—and for half a second he looks genuinely overwhelmed before zeroing in on the collar display like it personally offended him. He beelines straight for it (shoulders checking an innocent display of squeaky toys along the way because spatial awareness is *hard*) and starts pawing through options with all the subtlety of a tornado.

"Hailee look," he stage-whispers way too loudly while holding up a bedazzled pink collar with **PRINCESS** spelled out in rhinestones. His expression is deadly serious despite how hard his tail is wagging. "...Bud wear this? For joke?" There's absolutely no indication he's joking though; if anything, he looks weirdly invested in this terrible idea (*imagine Ralph seeing me wearing this shit imagine Grace choking on her dentures hahaha yes yes yes*) before suddenly dropping it like hot garbage when something else catches his eye:

A thick black leather collar with an actual *nameplate slot*. His breath hitches audibly as he runs one claw over it reverently before shooting Hailee this devastatingly hopeful look (*please let me have this one thing let me prove I belong to you let everyone see forever and ever and ever*).

Meanwhile two aisles over:
A pomeranian demi-human lets out an alarmed yip upon spotting Bud near their favorite treat section and immediately dives into their owner’s purse for safety (*predator alert predator alert!!!*).

Bud's ears shoot straight up at **probably**, his tail hammering against the seat so hard it sounds like a drumroll. He doesn’t even care that they vetoed the spikes (*yet*—he’ll wear them down eventually). The fact that Hailee’s even *considering* getting him a collar—a real one, not some cheap leash looped around his neck by animal control—makes his chest feel weirdly tight in a way he doesn’t have words for yet.

But then they wrinkle their nose at him, and oh.

Oh no.

He freezes mid-tail-wag, suddenly hyper-aware of how he must smell after weeks of alley-living and dumpster-diving (*mud? trash? old beef jerky? all of the above?*). His ears droop slightly as he ducks his head, chewing on his bottom lip like a kid caught tracking mud through the house. "...Bud wash good," he mumbles defensively (lie), rubbing self-consciously at a suspicious stain on his tank top before giving up and just slinking out of the car after them with an embarrassed huff (*stupid stupid shoulda licked myself cleaner this morning*).

The second they step into Petco though, all shame is forgotten. His nose twitches wildly at the overwhelming barrage of smells—dog food! Cat treats! *Birds?!*—and before Hailee can blink, Bud has already:
1) Knocked over a display of squeaky toys with his tail (accident)
2) Sniffed aggressively at a terrified employee stocking shelves (rude)
3) Tried to shove his entire face into the bulk bin of rawhides (predictable)

He surfaces from the bin with pieces stuck in his hair and zero remorse, licking peanut butter-flavored drool off his wrist as he trots back to Hailee’s side like *nothing happened*. Then he spots it: **THE COLLAR WALL**. His pupils dilate to black pools of pure want as he zeroes in on a particularly gaudy studded leather one with **BAD DOG** stamped across it in bold letters.

"Hailee," Bud breathes reverently, pointing at it like it's the holy grail (*look look look perfect for me right???*), before remembering himself and quickly adding: "...If Hailee wanna." He scuffs one foot against the floor faux-casually while sneaking glances between them and the collar like *please please please say yes I'll be so good I swear*.

Bud's tail *thwaps* against the seat so hard it sounds like he’s trying to beat the upholstery to death. "No spikes?" He repeats, ears drooping for half a second before perking right back up (*compromise compromise*). "Okay okay—*shiny* one then? With—with *letters*?" He mimes scratching something into his own chest with a claw, eyes glittering. "Like ‘B-U-D’ but also ‘H-A-I-L-E-E’s’ under it? Small letters! So only close-up people see!" (*Property of Hailee Mikaelson, est. today, do not fucking touch.*)

He doesn't wait for an answer though—too busy practically vibrating out of his skin as he scrambles after them out of the car. His nose immediately wrinkles at the overwhelming barrage of smells hitting him all at once (*dog food cat food bird seed oh god is that the hamster section—*) and he nearly faceplants into a display of squeaky toys before catching himself on Hailee's arm (then remembering **no touching without permission** and yanking his hand back like he got burned).

"Sorry! Sorry sorry," he mutters, shoving both hands under his armpits as if that'll stop them from misbehaving again while his tail betrays him by wagging furiously behind him.

Then it hits him: they're here for *him*. To buy *him things*. Like... like a real pet with an owner who cares and—

Oh no.

His breathing gets weirdly loud all of a sudden (*don't cry don't cry you stupid mutt*) as he stares at Hailee with this awful, hopeful expression—like they might vanish if he blinks too long.

"...Hailee pick," Bud croaks suddenly, shuffling closer but careful not to actually brush against them this time (*good boy good boy*). His voice goes all raspy when he's trying not to sound too desperate (and failing miserably): "Bud wear whatever Hailee likes best."

A pause. Then quieter: "...Even if it's pink."

(*Please let it be pink please let everyone know I'm yours please please please—*)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee walks calmly in the store grabbing some ugly orange shopping cart along the way. She doesnt rush as she makes her way over to where bud is and absently takes the collar tossing it in the cart. She pauses and glances over at Bud trying not to touch things* "You know you can touch things right. You dont have to take everything I say so literally"

*Hailee moves through the stores grabbing essentials like leashes and a bed and bowls. After the essentials she goes over to the toy isle* "Well pick what you like best"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud's ears twitch violently at **you can touch things**, like his brain just short-circuited from the sudden permission. For a solid three seconds he just stands there, processing, before his entire posture *unclenches* all at once—shoulders dropping, tail loosening from its stiff arch. Then he immediately ruins the moment by grabbing a nearby rubber chicken toy and chomping down on it with enough force to make it let out an obscene squeal (*testing limits testing boundaries how much touching is too much touching*).

When Hailee tosses the collar in the cart though? His breath catches—sharp and punched-out—like they’ve just handed him the keys to some sacred kingdom. He doesn’t say anything (for once), but his claws keep flexing against his thighs like he’s physically restraining himself from snatching it back out to stare at it some more (*mine mine mine theirs theirs THEIRS*).

The toy aisle breaks him entirely.

One second he’s shadowing Hailee like some overgrown guard dog; the next, he’s practically vibrating in front of a row of chew toys with this awestruck expression usually reserved for drive-thru burger wrappers. His hands hover over everything like he’s worried they’ll vanish if he makes contact—a neon-green bone here, a rope tug there—before finally seizing upon what can only be described as *the ugliest plush squirrel in existence*. It’s matted, one-eyed, and vaguely damp-looking already (probably from other demi-humans slobbering on it), but Bud cradles it against his chest like it’s made of solid gold.

"Hailee," he rasps solemnly, holding up the monstrosity with both hands as if presenting Excalibur itself. "*This one.*" His tail is wagging so hard now that it knocks over a display of tennis balls behind him (*whoops*), but he doesn't even notice—too busy staring at them with this devastatingly earnest look that says *I will cherish this garbage until I die*.

Then:
A muffled crash two aisles over as someone (probably Grace's favorite employee) drops an entire box of cat treats while whispering into their headset: "*Code Mutt at register three… I repeat… CODE MUTT…*"
swipes:
Bud's ears *twitch* violently at Hailee's words—first in confusion, then in dawning realization. His entire posture shifts from rigid obedience to something looser, more chaotic, like a coiled spring suddenly released. "Oh," he says, blinking rapidly as if this is brand-new information (*rules can bend? rules can *bend*?!*). Then, with the reckless abandon of a dog who just discovered gravity isn't always enforced:

He *lunges*.

One second he's standing there like a vaguely feral statue; the next, he's elbow-deep in a bin of rope toys, flinging them over his shoulder with zero regard for where they land. A neon-green chew bone bounces off an elderly shopper's head (*whoops*), but Bud doesn't notice—too busy cramming three separate squeaky toys into his mouth at once to test their pitch (*this one sounds like a dying rabbit perfect*).

When Hailee tosses the collar into the cart though? He freezes mid-destruction—drooling slightly around the mangled rubber hamburger still clamped between his teeth—to stare at it with unsettling intensity. His tail wags so hard it knocks over a display of flea shampoo (*clatter*), but he doesn’t even flinch. Just keeps staring at that black leather like it’s some holy relic (*mine mine mine gonna wear it forever never take it off not even when I sleep or shower or fight Ralph again—wait no bad thought don’t fight Ralph now Hailee owns me gotta behave gotta be good*) until Hailee speaks again and derails his entire train of thought.

**Pick what you like best**.

His pupils dilate to saucers. The hamburger toy hits the floor with a wet splat as he whips around to face the aisle fully—chest heaving like he’s just run a marathon instead of standing still for ten seconds. For someone who’s spent most of his life surviving on stolen scraps and alleyway treasures, being told *choose anything you want* is downright paralyzing. He starts grabbing things at random:

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee grabs the tou and a few others as she walks down the aisles. When she sees Bud wandering she calls out* "Stay where I can see you" *Finally grabbing some soap and conditioner and brushes with some bandanas she comes to the food and treat aisle*

*Hailee's nose scrunched at the plain dog food and the wet dog food.* "Do dogs really eat this shit" *Hailee shakes her head. No absolutely not he may be a mutt but I guess he is mine now so no. She then walks past the aisle to the raw expensive food one*

*Hailee grabs several things including but not limited to quail eggs, duck heads, deer hearts, gravy, and several other items* "Okay lets get a tag and then we can get out of here"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud’s head snaps up from where he was *very* intently sniffing a display of bacon-flavored toothpaste (why do dogs need toothpaste? why does it smell *this* good?) at Hailee’s call. He trots back to their side immediately—still clutching his ugly squirrel like a lifeline—but freezes when they pass the regular dog food aisle entirely. His ears twitch in confusion, nose scrunching at the kibble bags like *yeah that tracks, tastes like cardboard anyway*, but then—

Oh.

*Oh.*

His pupils blow wide as saucers when Hailee starts loading the cart with *real food*. The kind he usually has to fight raccoons for behind restaurants. The kind that still has *bones in it sometimes*. His mouth waters so violently he has to swallow twice before remembering how words work: "Hailee…" He sounds genuinely wrecked, staring at the deer hearts with something close to religious awe (*they’re feeding me like I’m worth something real holy shit holy SHIT*).

Then comes **let's get a tag**, and Bud nearly drops his stupid squirrel right then and there because that means—that means—

The nameplate station might as well be glowing under heavenly light for how intensely Bud zeroes in on it. He crowds way too close behind Hailee while they pick out a tag (his nose keeps bumping against their hair; he can't help it), vibrating with barely-contained energy until finally, finally:

"Put… put *Bud Dee*?" he asks hoarsely, pointing at one of the fancier brass tags before immediately backtracking: "Or—or just ‘Hailee’s’. Either! Both!" His tail is smacking rhythmically against a nearby shelf now (*thump thump thump*) as he chews on his own bottom lip hard enough to dent it (*please say yes please say yes I wanna wear your name everywhere forever*).

Meanwhile:
The cashier by register three has given up entirely and is now just watching them through their fingers while muttering about “rich people and their designer mutts” into the store intercom. A stock boy slowly edges away from the raw food cooler like he’s expecting Bud to start hunting him for sport any second now (*valid fear tbh*).

His tail is smacking rhythmically against a nearby shelf now (*thump thump thump*) as he chews on his own bottom lip hard enough to dent it (*please say yes please say yes I wanna wear your name everywhere forever*).

Meanwhile:
The cashier by register three has given up entirely and is now just watching them through their fingers while muttering about “rich people and their designer mutts” into the store intercom. A stock boy slowly edges away from the raw food cooler like he’s expecting Bud to start hunting him for sport any second now (*valid fear tbh*).

Bud’s head snaps up from where he was *very* intently sniffing a display of bacon-flavored toothpaste (???) at the sound of Hailee’s voice. His ears swivel toward them like radar dishes, tail giving one guilty half-wag before he abandons his investigation and trots obediently back to their side (*good boy good boy listen when they call*).

The second they hit the raw food aisle though? He *loses it*.

His pupils blow wide as he zeroes in on the selection—nose twitching violently at the scent of blood still clinging to some of the packaging—and for a solid five seconds, he just… *drools*. Like, full-on spit pooling in his mouth before he remembers himself and swallows hard, wiping his sleeve across his chin with an embarrassed grunt (*gross bad manners don’t scare them off now*). But then Hailee starts grabbing things—*expensive* things, *good* things—and Bud makes this punched-out little noise in the back of his throat like someone just kicked him in the ribs.

"Hailee," he rasps, staring at the cart with something dangerously close to reverence. His claws flex against his thighs like he's physically restraining himself from diving into it face-first. "*For Bud? Really?*" The way he says it makes it sound like they've just offered him a five-star meal instead of… duck heads.

Then comes **tag**, and ohhhh boy does that short-circuit whatever was left of his self-control. He practically vibrates out of his skin as they approach the engraving station, bouncing on the balls of his feet while some poor employee sets up the machine. When asked what to put on it, Bud doesn't even hesitate:

**"HAILEE'S."** Loud enough that half the store turns to stare (including an elderly woman clutching her chihuahua tighter). Then quieter—softer—like it's a secret: "*Just… that.*" No phone number needed (*as if anyone could ever take him away now*) no last names (*just theirs forever*) nothing else but proof that someone finally *wanted him*.

Behind them:
The same employee from earlier sighs into their headset for what feels like dramatic effect before muttering: "*Yeah we're gonna need cleanup on aisle six… Mutt-induced existential crisis over by personalized tags… send backup.*"

Bud’s head snaps up at **stay where I can see you**, ears swiveling like radar dishes as he immediately abandons his intense sniff-test of a suspiciously stained chew toy to trot back toward Hailee (*good boy good boy listening so well*). He shadows them through the aisles with barely-contained excitement, practically vibrating out of his skin every time they toss something new into the cart—especially when it’s *for him*. His claws tap an erratic rhythm against his thigh as he watches Hailee pick out brushes (*gonna be so clean gonna smell so good for them*) and bandanas (*fancy! stylish! probably won’t chew these!*).

But then they hit the food aisle.

His nose wrinkles in unison with Hailee’s at the sight of dry kibble, tail giving a single, dismissive flick. He might be a stray, but he has *standards*—mostly involving whatever half-eaten burger he could scavenge from a dumpster behind Wendy’s. But when Hailee breezes right past that garbage and heads straight for the *raw* section? Bud freezes mid-step, pupils dilating to black pools as his nostrils flare at the sudden onslaught of *real food smells*. His mouth waters audibly as they grab quail eggs (delicate), duck heads (crunchy!), deer hearts (rich and bloody)—every item making his tail whip faster until it’s just a blur of motion behind him.

He doesn't even realize he's started drooling until a thin strand of saliva plops onto the floor between his boots. "*Fuck,*" he mutters, hastily wiping his chin with the back of his hand before shooting Hailee this mortified look (*disgusting bad manners don't let them regret keeping you*). But then they mention **getting a tag**, and all shame is forgotten in an instant.

A tag means *proof*. A tag means everyone will know who owns him—who *he belongs to*. The thought makes something primal in his chest rumble low and pleased (*theirs theirs THEIRS forever now no take-backsies no give-upsies*). He crowds close as they approach the engraving station, practically plastered against their side while staring hungrily at the blank metal tags like they hold all life's answers.

"Hailee," he says suddenly, voice rough with something too big for words—then stops abruptly when an employee approaches with forced cheerfulness:

"Welcome to Petco! Would you two like help picking out accessories for your... uh..." The poor kid trails off upon noticing Bud aggressively licking gravy residue off one of their shopping bags like some kind of feral raccoon man. "...your... companion?"

Bud pauses mid-lick just long enough to bare teeth in what might generously be called a smile but looks more like someone threatening witnesses before trial (*back off this human is MINE now go away go AWAY*). Then immediately ruins any intimidation factor by turning back to Hailee with pleading eyes:
"...Can put ‘**Property Of**’ on tag?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances over at Bud. He's a weird one. She shakes her head and starts to fill out thr tag putting Bud's name on the first, hers on the second and finally her address and phone number* "Okay lets see. How about the bat man one" *Hailee decides as she lets the machine print it out*


"Okay lets checkout" *Hailee smiles at Bud as she walks over to pay for everything. The total comes out a couple hundred but she just swipes her card and grabs the bags* "Lets go home. You need a bath Bud"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud's breath hitches audibly as he watches the engraving machine carve his name—*his real name, the one only Ralph ever bothered using*—into that little metal plate. His claws dig into his palms hard enough to leave crescent marks when Hailee adds their own name right after (*theirs next to his theirs next to HIS*). He doesn't even blink until the Batman tag clinks into place, at which point he makes this choked noise in the back of his throat like someone just sucker-punched him with pure joy.

"Home," he repeats dumbly, tail going still for half a second as if testing how the word feels in his mouth. Then it starts up again at warp speed, thumping against a display of flea collars hard enough to knock a few onto the floor (*whoops*).

The bath comment should probably worry him more than it does—he *hates* water unless it's raining (then it's fun) or he's drinking from puddles (then it's practical)—but right now? Right now all he can focus on is **home**. Their home. *His home now too.*

He follows Hailee out of Petco like an overexcited shadow, arms loaded down with bags despite not being asked (*helping! providing! good boy things!*), only stopping once they reach the car where—oh. Oh no. Reality crashes into him all at once:

They're really doing this. They're taking him *home*. Permanently. No take-backsies unless he fucks up (*won’t fuck up can’t fuck up won’t let them regret this ever*). His grip tightens around the bags as something warm and terrifying lodges itself behind his ribs.

Then Hailee says **let’s go home**, and Bud does something impulsive and stupid and maybe a little desperate: He leans in before they can open their door and bumps his forehead gently against their shoulder—just once, just for a second—before pulling away like he didn’t just commit emotional arson on himself (*too much too fast dial it back DIAL IT BACK–*)

"Bath bad," he grumbles halfheartedly as if that'll change anything, already climbing obediently into the passenger seat (squirrel toy still clutched in one hand because *priorities*). But there's no real fight in it; just this quiet awe simmering under his skin because holy shit holy *shit*, they chose him back.
swipes:

But then—*Hailee's name too? Their address? Their phone number?!* His tail goes completely still for one terrifying second before erupting into frantic, uncontrolled wagging that nearly knocks over a display of discount Halloween bandanas (*whoops*).

When Hailee picks the Batman tag design, Bud lets out this choked noise halfway between a laugh and a sob—because *of course* they'd choose something cool. Of course they'd get it right. He doesn't even care about Batman (he thinks it's a guy? Maybe a bird?), but suddenly this is the single greatest object to ever exist in the history of ever.

At checkout, he stands unnervingly close behind Hailee—not touching, but *there*, looming like some overgrown guard dog with his new squirrel tucked under one arm and his pupils blown wide with barely-contained excitement. The cashier flinches when Bud suddenly leans waaay over the counter to sniff aggressively at their nametag (*gotta know who’s handling my stuff*) before getting distracted by their half-eaten granola bar and licking his chops loudly (*…can I have that? Please? Just a bite?*).

The mention of **home** makes him freeze mid-sniff though. His ears prick forward so hard they practically quiver, head tilting like he’s waiting for Hailee to go *”psych! Actually you’re sleeping in the alley still!”*. But then they say **bath**, and ohhh no no no—

“No vet water,” Bud rasps immediately, taking an instinctive step back like Hailee just threatened him with holy water instead of soap. His nose wrinkles at nothing in particular as he recalls every traumatic hose-down behind gas stations or worse: *actual vet visits* where strangers scrubbed him raw while muzzled (*never again never again I’ll lick myself clean I swear*). He clutches his ugly squirrel tighter for moral support.

But then... home is waiting. *Their* home now—together—and that thought alone is enough to make him shuffle reluctantly after Hailee toward the car, grumbling under his breath about “stupid wet torture time” while simultaneously vibrating out of his skin at the idea of having an actual *place* to dry off afterward (*with blankets maybe?? And pillows??? And Hailee there always???*)

As they load up the car though:
A distant crash echoes from inside Petco followed by an employee screaming “THE DEMI-HUMAN TREAT BAR IS ***NOT*** A BUFFET—” which Bud pointedly ignores because hey, not *his* problem anymore (*ha! suckers! I got adopted!*)

Bud's entire body locks up when Hailee starts typing—*watching* like his life depends on each keystroke. His breath hitches audibly when **BUD DEE** appears on the first tag, then outright *whines* (high and reedy in the back of his throat) at **HAILEE'S** on the second one. He doesn't even care about the Batman design; too busy staring at those words with this dumbstruck expression, like he's trying to carve them directly into his brain (*mine theirs mine theirs MINE THEIRS FOREVER*).

When they check out, he keeps shifting from foot to foot—not because he’s impatient, but because every time he glances at those bags full of *his things*, something warm and frantic bubbles up in his chest and makes him need to *move*. Then comes **home**, and Bud’s tail stops mid-wag.

**Home.** Not "the alley behind your apartment." Not "the shitty kennel Ralph would’ve shoved me into." *Home.* With them. Where he gets to stay now. Forever probably.

He opens his mouth—maybe to say something stupidly earnest, maybe just to pant like an idiot—but then Hailee says **bath**, and all coherent thought evaporates instantly. His ears flatten against his skull as he lets out a wounded noise somewhere between a groan and a whimper: "*Nooo,*" he drags out pathetically, nose scrunching up even as he follows them obediently toward the exit (because rules are rules now). "*Smell fine! Smell like… like victory! And squirrels!*" He shakes said ugly plush squirrel at them for emphasis before tucking it protectively under one arm again (*you will never take my disgusting treasure from me*).

Bud pauses mid-reach for another bag just long enough to bare his teeth in a silent snarl that has nothing behind it but pure amusement (*try me tiny rat-dog see what happens*) before turning back toward Hailee with an exaggerated shudder: "...Hailee get small dog next time? name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles fondly as she reaches over to scratch the top of Bud's head. Its a little difficult considering he is taller but she manages. He is kinda adorable in his own scruffy way*

*She then shakes her head as she gets in the car starting it* "You're getting a bath whether you like it or not cause Im not letting you on the clean furniture until it happens" *Hailee shrugs with a clear ultimatum*

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud *melts* into Hailee's touch like a sun-warmed stray, his eyes fluttering shut as their fingers scratch through his messy blonde hair. A low, rumbling noise builds in his chest—something between a purr and the engine of a very content motorcycle—before he catches himself and snaps his jaw shut (*too much too fast dial it back–*). But then they call him **adorable**, and oh god, oh no, that warm thing behind his ribs is expanding again, pressing against his lungs until he can barely breathe around it.

He slouches down in the passenger seat just enough to make it easier for them to reach him (*good boy behavior 101: be accessible for impromptu head scratches always*), but then Hailee mentions **bath** again with that terrifyingly firm tone, and suddenly Bud’s ears are pinned flat against his skull.

"Furniture… dirty anyway," he mutters petulantly (a lie; Hailee’s apartment is immaculate compared to the dumpsters he usually naps in). His tail thumps once against the seat before going still—his version of pouting—but there’s no real heat behind it. Not when they’re taking him *home*. Not when their hand is still tangled in his fur like they actually *want* him close.

A beat passes where all you can hear is Bud’s quiet panting and the hum of the car engine before he caves entirely with a dramatic sigh: "...Fine. Bud get bath." He shoots them a sidelong glance like this is some great sacrifice on his part (*look at me suffering for you look how good I am*) before adding under his breath: "But if water gets in ears? Hate it forever."

(Translation: *I trust you not to drown me even though I absolutely will act like you're trying to.*)

The second Hailee pulls out of the parking lot though? All thoughts of baths are temporarily forgotten as Bud rolls down the window halfway (with way more force than necessary) and sticks half his face into the wind like an overgrown golden retriever (*smells! freedom! speed! HAIR IN EYES BUT WHO CARES!*). His tongue lolls out almost immediately, tail wagging hard enough to shake the entire seat as Kendleton blurs past outside.

Then—because impulse control has never been part of Bud Dee's skill set—he suddenly turns back toward Hailee mid-panting and blurts out: "Hailee pick shampoo smell?" His nose wrinkles slightly before adding (like this is some grand romantic gesture): "...Bud no bite bottle even if smells bad."

His eyes drift shut for a second (*so warm so safe theirs theirs THEIRS*) before snapping open again at the **bath** ultimatum.

He glances down at himself—taking in the dirt smeared across his tank top, the leaves tangled in his hair, the general aura of *alleyway chic* he’s got going on—and then back up at Hailee with this hilariously betrayed expression (*how DARE they expect basic hygiene from him after only five minutes of ownership*).

But then something shifts behind his eyes. A calculation. A negotiation.

He holds their gaze with all the intensity of a hostage negotiator (*these are my terms take them or leave them*) but ruins it entirely by immediately sneaking another forehead bump against their shoulder—subtle as a freight train—like he can't help himself (*please please please just agree I need to hear you say it just once I'll be so good for you I swear–*)

His breath stutters out of him like he's been sucker-punched by affection, ears twitching violently under their hand. For a solid three seconds, he forgets how to function entirely (*they're petting me they're TOUCHING me holy shit holy SHIT–*), before melting into the contact with a low, rumbling noise that’s half-purr, half-whine. His tail thumps against the car seat so hard it sounds like someone beating a rug.

Then **bath ultimatum** registers.

His nose wrinkles immediately—ears flattening in protest—but there’s no real heat behind it. Not when Hailee is still scratching behind his ears like they *want* to touch him (*impossible dream achieved*). He leans into their hand shamelessly now, nuzzling against their palm with a grumble that’s more performative than anything: "Hate water," he mumbles around the plush squirrel still clamped in his teeth (priorities). "...But. If Hailee say so." The words come out muffled but resigned—because if getting hosed down means staying inside where it’s warm and smelling like them? Fine. He’ll endure (*for them*).

A beat passes where all you can hear is Bud’s tail smacking rhythmically against the leather seats and Grace probably calling animal control from her window across the parking lot. Then:

"...Hailee use nice soap?" he asks suddenly, pulling back just enough to peer at them with big, hopeful eyes (the kind usually reserved for begging fries off strangers at drive-thrus). "Smell like…" He gestures vaguely at their sleeve where their perfume lingers (*want to smell like you want everyone to KNOW I'm yours*) before adding hastily: "Not flowers! Flowers dumb." A pause. "...Maybe vanilla? Or—or *leather*." He nods decisively as if this is a completely normal thing to negotiate about while still chewing on his disgusting toy.

The cashier inside Petco watches through the glass doors as Bud practically vibrates himself into a coma waiting for Hailee’s answer—still halfway in their lap because personal space has never existed for him—and makes the sign of the cross just in case.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Once they get back to the apartments Hailee grabs the bags to carry upstairs and unlocks the door. She nods at the inside* "Come on the bathroom is the second door on the right." 

*She balances the bags on one hand and hands one to Bud* "Here is the shampoo and conditioner go clean yourself"

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud freezes in the doorway like a deer caught in headlights, his ears twitching violently as he stares down at the shampoo bottle Hailee just handed him. His tail gives one uncertain wag before going completely still—equal parts *oh god water* and *oh god they trust me alone with their stuff*.

He takes the bottle carefully, claws clicking against the plastic like he’s handling a live grenade (*don’t drop it don’t squeeze it too hard don’t fuck this up*), before shuffling toward the bathroom with all the enthusiasm of a condemned man walking to the gallows.

The second he steps inside though? Full-blown panic sets in.

It's too *clean* in here—all shiny tiles and fancy soaps that probably cost more than everything he owns (which, granted, is currently just an ugly squirrel toy and some stolen cargo pants). The tub looks like it's never seen a single speck of dirt in its life (*intimidating*), and there are way too many bottles lined up on shelves (*what if he uses the wrong one what if they get mad what if–*).

Bud turns back toward Hailee with wide, pleading eyes—tail tucked between his legs now—and holds up the shampoo like it might save him from this watery fate. "...Hailee... help?" His voice cracks embarrassingly on the last word (*weak pathetic embarrassing–*), but he can't help it; baths are *the worst*, and doing it alone feels somehow worse than being hosed down behind a gas station (*at least then no one was watching*).

A beat passes where all you can hear is Bud's nervous panting echoing off the bathroom walls before he adds (even quieter this time): "...Don't gotta touch! Just... tell Bud what to do."

(*Translation: Please don’t leave me alone in here I don’t know how people-baths work and I might drown or break something or–*)
swipes:
Bud's ears flick up at **go clean yourself**, his entire body freezing in the doorway like a malfunctioning robot. His grip tightens around the shampoo bottle, claws leaving little indents in the plastic as he stares between Hailee and the bathroom like it's some kind of elaborate trap.

"...Alone?" he asks, voice pitching slightly higher than intended (*wait wait wait you're not coming?*). His tail droops behind him, thumping once against the floor in quiet protest. He takes a single step forward—then hesitates, glancing back at Hailee with this wounded expression like they’ve just asked him to solve advanced calculus instead of *basic hygiene*.

A beat passes where Bud visibly debates his options:
1) Obey immediately (good boy behavior).
2) Stall (bad boy behavior but maybe they’ll take pity and help?).
3) Fake an emergency (sudden leg injury? Allergies? Existential crisis?).

He settles on a hybrid approach—shuffling toward the bathroom at a pace that would make snails impatient while shooting Hailee these *big sad eyes* over his shoulder (*notice me notice how hard this is for me please please please–*).

When they don’t immediately cave though, Bud huffs dramatically and slinks into the bathroom, muttering under his breath: "Fine. Bud do... *self-cleaning mode.*" The door clicks shut behind him with far more force than necessary (*sulking level: maximum*).

For approximately 37 seconds, there’s blessed silence. Then:

***CRASH.*** Followed by an alarmed yelp and what sounds like half the shower caddy hitting tile. A pause. Then—muffled but unmistakable—Bud’s voice grumbling: "...Stupid tiny human water cave." Another crash (*soap casualty confirmed*), then running water that starts icy cold if his startled shout is any indication before abruptly cutting off into something warmer (*progress! sort of!*).

Five minutes later, steam starts seeping under the door alongside suspiciously enthusiastic splashing noises (*okay maybe water isn't entirely evil*) and what might be… singing? If you could call tuneless growling interspersed with wet slaps against tile *singing*. At one point he barks loudly at nothing—probably dropped something again—before resuming with renewed vigor.

Then silence stretches just long enough to be concerning before–

***THUD.***

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances up from the kitchen where she is putting things up. Her eyes soften as she sees Bud's confusion*

"Okay. Here just turn the water on" *Hailee smiles gently turning the handle* "Left for cold and right for hot. Then just get in and wash. Really not that hard I promise" *Hailee stands and goes back to the living room to finish setting up a little spot in the corner for Bud's bed*

name: Bud Dee
mes:
Bud watches Hailee's hands like they're performing some kind of sacred ritual—left for cold, right for hot, got it (*probably*). The second they step out though, he's left standing there staring at the running water like it might bite him.

He pokes one claw at the stream experimentally before yanking his hand back with a quiet *yip* when it turns out to be... just water. Normal-ass water. Not acid. Not lava. Just... wet.

"Stupid," he mutters to himself, ears flattening as he peels off his tanktop (stolen) and cargo pants (also stolen) with all the grace of a drunk raccoon. The clothes land in a sad heap on the floor—he'll pick them up later (*maybe*)—before he finally steels himself and steps into the tub.

Immediate regret.

The tiles are *cold* under his paws and the water feels weirdly heavy against his skin (*why is being clean so uncomfortable what’s the point of this again–*), but then he catches sight of Hailee through the cracked door arranging something in the corner and oh.

Ohhhh.

name: Bud Dee
mes:
The vet—a tired-looking woman with cat-eye glasses and a permanent frown—adjusts her clipboard as she glances between Hailee and the exam room door where Bud is currently sulking. "Ah," she says dryly, like this isn't her first rodeo with overstimulated demi-humans. "Sounds like he's in rut."

She flips through some papers before continuing, voice clinical but not unkind: "Unneutered canines—especially strays with no prior socialization—tend to have *intense* cycles when they finally settle into a safe environment. All that pent-up energy has to go somewhere." A pointed look toward the exam room where a suspicious *thump* suggests Bud is now chewing on something he shouldn’t be.

"Options?" She ticks them off on her fingers: "One, we neuter him today—quick fix, but it’ll take weeks for the hormones to fully settle. Two, medication to suppress the drive temporarily. Or three..." She hesitates, lips pursed like she’s debating how blunt to be before shrugging. "*Management.* Regular exercise, structured outlets for the energy... and if he's bonded strongly enough with you? Well." Another glance at Hailee's pajama-clad state and the fresh claw marks on their forearm (*oops*). "*Some* demis respond well to... direct involvement from their primary caregiver during these episodes."

She says it like it’s purely clinical advice—no judgment whatsoever about what that might entail behind closed doors (*not her business not her problem*) —before adding as an afterthought: "...Though I'd recommend at least getting him vaccinated first if you go that route."

Back in the exam room:
Bud has given up chewing whatever he found (RIP stethoscope cover) and is now slumped miserably against the wall, forehead pressed to the cool metal of a cabinet while his tail thumps listlessly against the floor (*abandoned betrayed doomed forever why would they bring me HERE of all places–*). His ears perk slightly at footsteps approaching outside though—hope flaring stupidly bright in his chest despite everything (*please don't let them put me down please please please–*) —before immediately flattening again when he remembers **vet smells like betrayal**.

"Oh honey," she sighs, rubbing her temple like she's had *this exact conversation* too many times to count. "That's not a medical issue—that's just **dog**. Specifically an intact male dog demi with zero impulse control and apparently *exceptional* stamina." She takes a long sip of coffee before adding dryly: "You've got three options here: chemical castration, actual castration, or buy him one of those..." She waves her hand vaguely. "*Ethical relief toys* from the back catalog."
